marketNews.title: Property Marketing Sales Compilation 1H25
marketNews.content: Several residential property issuers have announced their marketing sales realization for 1H25, including Ciputra Development ($CTRA), Summarecon Agung ($SMRA), and Pakuwon Jati ($PWON) [see table]. CTRA recorded the highest realization against its marketing sales target (52%). CTRA's relatively good 1H25 achievement was supported by the launch of new clusters, which contributed ~54% to the total 2Q25 marketing sales. Meanwhile, SMRA recorded high 1H25 marketing sales growth (+42% YoY), resulting in a relatively better realization against the target (43%) compared to last year (1H24: 34% against target). The 1H25 marketing sales achievement itself was driven by the 100% government-borne value-added tax (PPN DTP) incentive. Throughout 1H25, PWON became the issuer with the highest contribution of PPN DTP to marketing sales, where 75% of the company's total marketing sales realization came from products eligible for this incentive. Meanwhile, SMRA has not released data regarding the contribution of PPN DTP. However, in 1H24, the contribution of products eligible for this incentive reached 61% of SMRA's marketing sales. The 100% PPN DTP incentive itself ends as of June 2025. During the July-December 2025 period, the incentive will be reduced to 50%. Key Takeaway: Generally, marketing sales realization in 2H25 has the potential to be more challenging in line with the decline in the incentive amount, thus requiring other positive catalysts to support sales. On the other hand, investors need to monitor Bank Indonesia's interest rate decision on Wednesday (16/7). As many as 18 out of 33 economists surveyed by Bloomberg predict the interest rate will be cut, with the rest predicting BI will maintain the rate. Although we assess the positive impact of an interest rate cut on sales as relatively limited, an interest rate cut still has the potential to provide positive sentiment for property stocks.

marketNews.title: Other hot additional information you need to know...
marketNews.content: 1. China's national statistics bureau recorded that China's economy in 2Q25 grew +5.2% YoY (vs. 1Q25: +5.4% YoY), above consensus expectations which predicted growth of +5.1% YoY. This economic growth was driven by strong exports to non-US markets, while domestic consumer demand remains weak. 2. President Director of BPJS Kesehatan, Ghufron Mukti, said that the Coordination of Benefits (CoB) scheme can already be used by BPJS Kesehatan participants. Ghufron added that this scheme applies to BPJS Kesehatan class 1 and class 2 participants. For information, CoB is a scheme to maximize health guarantee benefits for participants who have both BPJS and supplementary health insurance. 3. Bloomberg reported that the Indonesian Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, said that Indonesia will only realize the plan to purchase oil-related products from the US worth 10-15 billion US dollars if the US lowers tariffs for Indonesia. Previously, it was reported that Indonesia had offered up to 15.5 billion US dollars for the purchase of energy products from the US in an effort to reduce the trade surplus and obtain lower tariffs. 4. Perum Bulog stated it will involve village/sub-district cooperatives (kopdes/kel) Merah Putih as partners for distributing rice for food supply and price stabilization (SPHP). President Director of Perum Bulog, Ahmad Rizal Ramdhani, said that Merah Putih kopdes/kel can apply for the required amount of rice at the local Bulog office. Besides SPHP rice, Merah Putih kopdes/kel will also distribute products from ID Food to Pertamina. 5. The Minister of Housing and Settlement Areas (PKP), Maruarar Sirait, stated on Monday (14/7) that the technical rules for the distribution of People's Business Credit (KUR) for the housing sector amounting to 130 trillion rupiah are currently under discussion. The regulation will take the form of a Ministerial Decree (Kepmen), targeted for issuance at the end of July 2025. Previously, the Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, revealed that the People's Business Credit (KUR) ceiling for housing will be raised up to 5 billion rupiah for MSME contractors building Type 36 houses.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Wins New Contract Worth Rp3.5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: PTRO: Petrosea announced it has signed a stripping and topsoil removal service contract with PT Barasentosa Lestari (BSL) in North Musi Rawas Regency, South Sumatra Province. The contract has a term of 5 years with an estimated contract value of around 3.5 trillion rupiah. BSL is a business entity of Golden Energy Mines ($GEMS).

tickerNews.title: BRPT Clarifies No Immediate IPO Plans for Two Prajogo Group Companies
tickerNews.content: $BRPT: Corporate Communication of Barito Pacific Group, Angelin Sumendap, told Katadata that PT Griya Idola and an unmentioned gold mining company do not currently have plans for an IPO. Currently, both companies are focusing on implementing their business development strategies. This clarification follows reports that both companies were preparing for an IPO.

tickerNews.title: INET Plans to Issue Series II Warrants Alongside Rights Issue
tickerNews.content: $INET: Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima announced that the company plans to issue a maximum of 3.2 billion new shares of Second Series Warrants in conjunction with a rights issue of up to 12.8 billion new shares. This implies that for every 4 new shares resulting from the rights issue, 1 Series II warrant is attached. Funds from the warrant exercise will be used for expansion and business development in the telecommunications sector. The warrant issuance plan will be discussed at the EGMS on August 20, 2025. Previously, INET obtained approval to execute a rights issue of up to 12.8 billion new shares in the EGMS on June 12, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Major Shareholder PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa Increases Stake in IMPC
tickerNews.content: $IMPC: Impack Pratama Industri shareholder, PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa, purchased approximately 392 million IMPC shares at an average price of 300 rupiah per share between July 10-15, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 118 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa's ownership in IMPC increased from 45.11% to 45.84%.

tickerNews.title: KRAS Prepares 200 Hectares of Industrial Estate Development in Cilegon
tickerNews.content: $KRAS: Finance and Risk Management Director of Krakatau Steel, Daniel Fitzgerald Liman, stated that the company is preparing an industrial estate development plan in Cilegon by utilizing 200 hectares of currently uncultivated land. This project will focus on building a steel-based industrial ecosystem, which is expected to become the main benchmark for Krakatau Steel's revival going forward. Daniel added that this project has the potential to attract investor interest and open monetization opportunities, but it remains directed towards supporting the downstream national steel industry.
